TEXT: The applicant , Mr Ferhat Kilic , is a NORP national who lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr Ulrik Rasmussen , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The applicant was born on CARDINAL DATE in GPE . In order to join his father , who had lived in GPE since DATE , on DATE the applicant entered GPE together with his mother . At the relevant time the applicant was DATE . He spent most of his childhood and youth in GPE . It appears that twice during DATE he spent DATE in GPE . He left school after DATE schooling and has never had any affiliation to the labour market .

His parents , CARDINAL siblings , his paternal grandmother and CARDINAL uncles also all live in GPE . DATE , the applicant has been on holiday for a longer period in GPE , where his mother ’s family and CARDINAL paternal aunts live . The applicant ’s family in GPE owns a house in GPE with several apartments , which are used by the family upon their visits to their country of origin . He speaks NORP and NORP .

By a ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was convicted of CARDINAL independent assaults . As to the first assault , jointly with another perpetrator , the applicant had overturned a cyclist , beaten and kicked him , including on the head , resulting in the victim being badly injured , i.e. , among other things , he broke his knee cap . As to the second assault , the applicant had been caught in the act of burglary by the house owner in question , upon which the applicant beat and kicked the latter , including on the head . The applicant was sentenced to CARDINAL days’ imprisonment suspended on probation . The judgment was appealed against to ORG of Eastern Denmark ( PERSON ) .

By a ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was again convicted , inter alia , of CARDINAL independent assaults of respectively a headmaster and a police officer . He was sentenced to spend DATE at a detention centre for children and young persons and thereafter DATE at an institution for youth persons . The applicant appealed against the judgment to ORG of Eastern GPE .
On DATE the High Court confirmed both ORG judgments . It decided , however , to fix a joint sentence , thus maintaining the sentence set out in ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the applicant and his cousin were arrested and charged , inter alia , with attempted robbery , aggravated assault and manslaughter . They were detained on remand the following day .

On DATE they were convicted by ORG of Eastern GPE sitting with a jury . It found it established that on DATE , when the applicant was DATE and his cousin DATE , jointly they had threatened a young man , an NORP tourist , with a knife in order to steal his money . Although the young man was stabbed by the applicant ’s cousin , he first managed to flee . Shortly thereafter the applicant and his cousin ran him down , beat him , and the applicant ’s cousin stabbed him several times , the injuries inflicted resulting in the victim ’s death .

By the same judgment , the applicant was also convicted of : burglary committed on DATE with regard to goods equal to an amount of MONEY ( ORG ) ; and CARDINAL counts of escape from detention centres for children and young persons , namely in the periods from DATE until DATE , when he was arrested by the police ; from DATE until DATE , when he was again arrested by the police ; from DATE until DATE , when he was arrested by the police ; and from the afternoon on DATE until later on DATE , when he was arrested by the police .

According to a psychiatric report of DATE , the applicant was not found to be mentally sick but he did have character flaws such as abdication of responsibility . Since his childhood he had behavioural problems and since puberty he had abused hashish .

In its judgment , ORG of ORG sentenced the applicant to eight years’ imprisonment . In addition , he was expelled from GPE for an indefinite time to be implemented after the sentence had been served .

The applicant ’s cousin , who was also convicted of additional offences to attempted robbery , aggravated assault and manslaughter , was sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment and expulsion from GPE for an indefinite time .
Upon appeal , ORG ( Højesteret ) confirmed the sentences on DATE . With regard to the order to expel the applicant and his cousin , the majority of CARDINAL judges held as follows :

[ The applicant ’s cousin ] was born in GPE , whereas [ the applicant ] arrived as a threeyearold . They have spent their youth and had their schooling in this country where also their parents and siblings live . Thus , they have a strong connection with the NORP society and to people living here . At the same time , however , they have a [ significant ] connection with GPE and NORP culture . They speak NORP and DATE they have visited GPE where they have a big family . Both have been previously convicted , and have now been sentenced to longer prison terms , inter alia , for manslaughter , attempted robbery and aggravated assault . Having taken all considerations into account , in our view neither the elements mentioned in section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL of LAW ( PERSON ) nor LAW speak decisively against [ their ] expulsion . Accordingly , we vote [ for their expulsion ] .
The minority of CARDINAL judge held as follows :

In my view , when taking all the elements mentioned in section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL of LAW into account , the connection which the applicant and [ his cousin ] have with GPE and NORP culture , is not of such an extent and character that it has decisive weight when compared to their strong connection to the NORP society and people living here . In my opinion , the latter speaks significantly against expelling the applicant and his cousin from GPE . Accordingly , notwithstanding the serious crimes committed , I vote [ against their expulsion ] .
The relevant provision of LAW ( PERSON ) applicable at the time read as follows :
“ An alien who has lawfully stayed in GPE for more than DATE , and an alien issued with a residence permit under sections DATE may be expelled only if :

( i ) the alien is sentenced to minimum DATE imprisonment or other criminal sanction involving or allowing deprivation of liberty in respect of an offence that would have resulted in a punishment of this duration .

( vi ) the alien is sentenced , pursuant to ... Articles ... [ manslaughter , aggravated assault , robbery , etc ] of LAW to imprisonment or other criminal sanction involving or allowing deprivation of liberty in respect of an offence that would have resulted in a punishment of this nature . ”
CARDINAL . NORP In deciding on expulsion , regard must be had to the question whether expulsion must be assumed to be particularly burdensome , in particular because of :
( i ) the alien ’s ties with the NORP community , including whether the alien came to GPE in his childhood or DATE ;
( ii ) the duration of the alien ’s stay in GPE ;
( iii ) the alien ’s age , health , and other personal circumstances ;
( iv ) the alien ’s ties with persons living in GPE ;
( v ) the consequences of the expulsion for the alien ’s close relatives living in GPE ;
( vi ) the alien ’s slight or non - existent ties with his country of origin or any other country in which he may be expected to take up residence ; and

( vii ) the risk that , in cases other that those mentioned in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) , the alien will be ill - treated in his country of origin or any other country in which he may be expected to take up residence .
CARDINAL . An alien may be expelled pursuant to LAW to ( vi ) unless the circumstances mentioned in subsection CARDINAL above constitute a decisive argument against doing so .
